item.title: Shaun Johnson signs three-year deal with Cronulla Sharks - The Guardian
item.description:
Shaun Johnson signs three-year deal with Cronulla Sharks  The Guardian

Kiwi superstar Shaun Johnson has been given a chance to secure his legacy after signing a three-year NRL deal with Cronulla. Johnson was on Saturday spotted in the Shire meeting with coach Shane Flanagan and senior players Wade Graham and Andrew Fifita before officially putting pen to paper on a long-term deal. Related: England end Test series on sour note with thrashing by New Zealand While the Sharks were always the front-runners to secure the New Zealand Test playmaker’s signature after he was granted a release from the Warriors, it was rumoured he was only set to sign a one-year deal wi...

item.description:
NRL live: Tigers take on Dragons after Warriors pip Titans  ABC News

The Titans take on the Warriors across the ditch before the Tigers and Dragons do battle. Follow all the live scores, stats and commentary. (AAP: David Rowland) Kieran Foran's long-awaited return to the NRL helped the New Zeala...

item.title: Sam Burgess insists England can still win Four Nations despite loss to Kiwis - The Guardian
item.description:
Sam Burgess insists England can still win Four Nations despite loss to Kiwis  The Guardian

Sam Burgess insisted England can still win the Four Nations, a comment echoed by his coach after their loss to New Zealand in their opening game. The one-point defeat means England will have to beat Scotland and Australia to stand any chance of making the final at Anfield on 20 November; a daunting task given England have not beaten the Kangaroos for more than 20 years. Burgess remained upbeat following his first game as captain of the national side, one that slipped up despite dominating proceedings for large parts of the contest. Shaun Johnson’s late drop goal helped the Kiwis win 17-16. ...

item.title: Storm get better of Dragons in top of NRL table clash - The Guardian
item.description:
Storm get better of Dragons in top of NRL table clash  The Guardian

Melbourne will head into the representative round with a four-point lead atop the NRL ladder after hammering St George Illawarra 34-22 in their top-of-the-table clash. Billy Slater, Josh Addo-Carr and Suliasi Vunivalu all scored two tries each, while Cameron Smith kicked the 943rd goal of his career to break Jason Taylor’s record of most goals in history. The Storm dominated early, racing to a 34-4 lead early in the second half before Dragons veteran Jason Nightingale bagged two of his own to give the WIN Stadium crowd of 12,377 a whiff of a comeback. Related: Tigers' instability 'takes its...

item.title: NRL live: Broncos v Cowboys - ABC News
item.description:
NRL live: Broncos v Cowboys  ABC News

The Broncos are set for another blockbuster against the Cowboys, after the Storm beat the Warriors. Follow all the stats that matter in our live score centre. Quick navigation - Warriors v Storm - Broncos v Cowboys Broncos v Cowboys Live stream v Broncos v Cowboys live from 8:00pm AEDT Live summary External Link: NRL Broncos v Cowboys summary Live chalkboard External Link: NRL Broncos v Cowboys chalkboard Live stats External Link: NRL Broncos v Cowboys stats Warriors v Storm Photo: Rain made conditions difficult, but winger Suliasi Vunivalu scored one of the Storm's four tries. (AAP: David ...

item.title: England denied again by New Zealand’s Shaun Johnson in Four Nations - The Guardian
item.description:
England denied again by New Zealand’s Shaun Johnson in Four Nations  The Guardian

This was the opening group game for England and New Zealand but it was easily the most important and how the Kiwis’ celebrations at full-time showed it. Victory here and one win from the final two games would almost certainly be enough to progress to the final. Defeat? The fearsome prospect of having to beat Australia in the group stage – as well as Scotland – to stand a chance of making it to Anfield. That is the daunting task that awaits Wayne Bennett and England after another case of so near yet so far. Three years ago, as England seemed certain to qualify for the World Cup final, Shaun ...

item.title: Parramatta put troubles behind them as Corey Norman stars in win at Manly - The Guardian
item.description:
Parramatta put troubles behind them as Corey Norman stars in win at Manly  The Guardian

Corey Norman led a change of NRL fortunes for Parramatta, starring in an 20-12 win over Manly to open their season on Sunday. Norman’s off-field woes symbolised the Eels’ tumultuous and salary-cap scandal ravaged 2016 season, suspended by the NRL for the last eight games of the year for off-field indiscretions. Related: Roosters beat Titans, Dragons smash Panthers, bizarre try seals Cowboys win But he was the Eels’ best in his return on Sunday afternoon at Manly’s renamed Lottoland, scoring one try and setting up another as Parramatta turned over a new leaf. After Manly opened the scoring e...

item.title: Kieran Foran cleared by NRL to play in Warriors' 2017 season - The Guardian
item.description:
Kieran Foran cleared by NRL to play in Warriors' 2017 season  The Guardian

Kieran Foran has been cleared to return to the NRL with the governing body registering his Warriors contract for the 2017 season but he will not be available for the first two matches and must undergo a final psychological assessment before taking the playing field. The 26-year-old former New Zealand Test five-eighth departed Parramatta midway through last season to address personal issues. Related: Semi Radradra free to play NRL after domestic violence hearing adjourned “Naturally I would love to return in round one because I love rugby league and I love being part of the Warriors squad,” ...

item.title: England vs New Zealand match report: Hosts fall agonisingly short in Four Nations opener - The Independent
item.description:
England vs New Zealand match report: Hosts fall agonisingly short in Four Nations opener  The Independent

New Zealand half-back Shaun Johnson was again the scourge of England as they fell agonisingly short in their Ladbrokes Four Nations opener in Huddersfield. The man who broke English hearts in the 2013 World Cup semi-final returned to haunt them in his first game back in the country by orchestrating a 17-16 victory for New Zealand. Johnson ran the show throughout and came up with the crucial scores, a 70-metre interception try and the winning drop goal, to put the Kiwis in sight of the Anfield final and leave England with the onerous task of beating Australia to give themselves a chance of g...

item.title: Kieran Foran scores on NRL return as Warriors down Titans - The Guardian
item.description:
Kieran Foran scores on NRL return as Warriors down Titans  The Guardian

Kieran Foran’s long-awaited return to the NRL helped the New Zealand Warriors reverse their recent form and record a come-from-behind 28-22 win over the Gold Coast Titans in Auckland. Foran was making his first appearance in 10 months on Sunday, after his late withdrawal last week with a hamstring strain. He worked his way in to the game, becoming more influential as it progressed with his organisation and his running at the line. Related: Unbeaten Storm race ahead after victory over Panthers It was his bust between two defenders with 18 minutes to go that produced his side’s fourth try, wh...

item.title: Did Shaun Johnson miss his game-winning field goal in the Four Nations? - ABC News
item.description:
Did Shaun Johnson miss his game-winning field goal in the Four Nations?  ABC News

New Zealand half-back Shaun Johnson came through for the Kiwis with a clutch field goal to sink England in the Four Nations ... or did he? The hosts were beaten 17-16 on Sunday morning (AEDT), but video of the Kiwis' match-winning moment posted online certainly makes the goal look a bit iffy, even when zoomed in and slowed down. External Link: Did Shaun Johnson miss that field goal? The live television shots lost the ball out of frame, but the replay from behind the posts calls into question the validity of the 65th-minute one-pointer. External Link: Did Shaun Johnson's field goal go throug...

item.title: Weakened England end series on sour note as New Zealand run riot - The Telegraph
item.description:
Weakened England end series on sour note as New Zealand run riot  The Telegraph

There was talk beforehand that England, having already wrapped up the series, could come unstuck in Leeds. Nobody said anything about falling apart at the seams. A 3-0 Test series whitewash beckoned Wayne Bennett’s side after two close-fought victories at Hull and Anfield. It would have been some way to sign off a year in which England also beat New Zealand in Denver in June. Yet the Kiwis showed their mettle here to inflict a humiliating defeat, in scoreline if not overall performance, and ensure England’s year ended on a sour note. England had three calls for a try dismissed by video refe...

item.title: England's unbeaten run comes to an end as New Zealand cruise to victory in Leeds - The Independent
item.description:
England's unbeaten run comes to an end as New Zealand cruise to victory in Leeds  The Independent

England lost their scoring touch and their unbeaten record for 2018 as New Zealand cruised to a 34-0 win at Elland Road to avoid a series whitewash. Wayne Bennett's men went into the third Test with high hopes of a fourth-successive win over the Kiwis but a scoreline of six tries to nil accurately sums up an anti-climatic end to the season. The series of course belongs to England, courtesy of their close-fought wins in Hull and Liverpool, but this was more like the New Zealand side which showed their class with a victory over Australia a month ago. Scrum-half Kodi Nikorima, who plays under ...

item.title: Tommy Makinson's hat-trick helps England to series win over New Zealand - The Telegraph
item.description:
Tommy Makinson's hat-trick helps England to series win over New Zealand  The Telegraph

Hat-trick hero Tommy Makinson is the perfect poster boy for the England side who clinched their Test series against New Zealand with next week’s game still to play. From the assurance with which he played, it was easy to forget that the St Helens man, who was just as impressive defensively as he was in attack, was making just his third international appearance. With a number of high-profile players such as usual captain Sam Burgess absent, Makinson, who was named man of the match, perfectly represents the relatively inexperienced yet composed side who came through two tight games. Last week...

item.title: Sam Tomkins aiming to get better of Kiwi superstar Shaun Johnson on England return - The Telegraph
item.description:
Sam Tomkins aiming to get better of Kiwi superstar Shaun Johnson on England return  The Telegraph

Sam Tomkins says his half-back duel with his former New Zealand Warriors team-mate Shaun Johnson could help determine the outcome of England's first Test against the Kiwis. England head coach Wayne Bennett sprung a couple of surprises with his final team selection, recalling Tomkins after a four-year absence and dropping centre Mark Percival for the opening game at Hull's KCOM Stadium. As expected, Wigan centre Oliver Gildart will make his Test debut but Bennett has caused a stir over his decision to pick the versatile Jake Connor ahead of Percival. The St Helens player was largely ignored ...

item.title: Oliver Gildart enjoys debut to remember as England draw first blood in Test series against New Zealand - The Independent
item.description:
Oliver Gildart enjoys debut to remember as England draw first blood in Test series against New Zealand  The Independent

A wonderful solo try from centre Oliver Gildart on his debut helped England to a hard-fought 18-16 victory in the opening match of the three-Test series against New Zealand. England were trailing 16-14 when Gildart, a late call-up for the series, produced a moment of brilliance to light up a dour, at-times ferocious, battle and get the post-World Cup era under Wayne Bennett off to a dream start. Bennett could call on just seven survivors from December’s World Cup final but he will be thrilled by the contribution of newcomers Gildart, Jake Connor, Luke Thompson and Tom Makinson, who all look...

item.title: Kangaroos avoid consecutive defeats with win over Tonga - ABC News
item.description:
Kangaroos avoid consecutive defeats with win over Tonga  ABC News

The 26,214 crowd prayed for a Tonga comeback — and it almost worked. But in the end the Kangaroos proved why they are the world champions by overcoming a second half fightback to prevail 34-16 in their historic Test match. The Mate Ma'a were behind by 20 and had forced the Kangaroos into a fourth straight line dropout when the sellout Mt Smart Stadium crowd broke into hymns. And their prayers were answered when Solomone Kata crossed, instantly reviving memories of their near upset of England in their World Cup semi-final last year. External Link: Australia v Tonga summary However, that was ...

item.title: Kangaroos' new era starts with shock loss to New Zealand - ABC News
item.description:
Kangaroos' new era starts with shock loss to New Zealand  ABC News

A Joey Manu-inspired New Zealand has brought Australia crashing back to earth with a 26-24 upset in their rugby league Test at Mt Smart Stadium. The Kangaroos had their 13-game winning streak broken on Saturday and tasted their first Test loss under coach Mal Meninga. After the retirement of a golden generation of players including Johnathan Thurston, Cooper Cronk, Billy Slater and Cameron Smith, the Aussies are facing a rebuild. Manu upstaged his Sydney Roosters teammate, superstar Latrell Mitchell, scoring one try and setting up another in a rampaging performance, while Shaun Johnson was ...

item.title: Roosters through to preliminary final, Sharks to meet Panthers - ABC News
item.description:
Roosters through to preliminary final, Sharks to meet Panthers  ABC News

The Sydney Roosters are through to an NRL preliminary final for the fifth time in six years after downing the Cronulla Sharks 21-12 in the NRL qualifying final. The Sharks struck early through flyer Valentine Holmes and took the lead once again shortly after half-time, but the Roosters closed out the game under the guidance of halfback Cooper Cronk in the final 10 minutes. The Sharks lost backrower Wade Graham to a knee injury, and will need to rebound next week to face a Penrith Panthers side brimming with confidence after its 27-12 win over the New Zealand Warriors. More to come. External...

item.title: Johnathan Thurston leads Cowboys to victory in final home appearance - ABC News
item.description:
Johnathan Thurston leads Cowboys to victory in final home appearance  ABC News

Johnathan Thurston says goodbye to his Townsville fans in style as the Cowboys hammer the Eels 44-6, after the Warriors smashed the Panthers 36-16. Quick navigation - FT: Cowboys def. Eels 44-6 - FT: Warriors def. Panthers 36-16 - NRL ladder Cowboys give JT a home farewell to remember Photo: Johnathan Thurston (R) with Cowboys teammate Justin O'Neill during the win over the Eels. item.description:
Roosters edge rival Rabbitohs, Warriors continue charge against Knights  ABC News

The Roosters get the better of rival South Sydney in a Friday night blockbuster after the Warriors took care of the Knights in a 20-4 win. Get the full story on both NRL games. Quick navigation - FT: Warriors 20-4 Knights - FT: Rabbitohs 14-18 Roosters - NRL ladder Roosters go top with win over Rabbitohs Photo: The Roosters got the edge over their fierce rivals on Friday night. (AAP: Dan Himbrechts) The Sydney Roosters have jumped to the top of the NRL ladder with a gutsy 18-14 win over arch-rivals South Sydney. The Roosters proved their premiership credentials on Friday night with a win bu...

item.description:
NRL live: Titans facing Roosters after Tigers, Warriors post victories  ABC News

The Titans host the Roosters at Robina, as the Tigers upset the Dragons 20-16 and the Warriors celebrate their 26-6 triumph over the Broncos. Follow all the live scores, stats and commentary. item.title: NRL live: It's Manly v Canberra after Warriors take the Roosters - ABC News
item.description:
NRL live: It's Manly v Canberra after Warriors take the Roosters  ABC News

It's Manly v Canberra on Easter Saturday, after the Warriors travel to Sydney and beat the Roosters. Follow the scores, stats and commentary via our live ScoreCentre. Quick navigation - Roosters v Warriors - Sea Eagles - Raiders Sea Eagles v Raiders Live stream v Listen live: Sea Eagles v Raiders from 7:35pm AEDT Live summary [Summary] Live chalkboard [Chalkboard] Live stats External Link: Sea Eagles - Raiders stats Warriors still perfect after win over Roosters Photo: The New Zealand Warriors won their fourth straight game with a comprehensive victory over the Roosters. (AAP: Daniel Munoz)...

item.title: Sea Eagles repel the Raiders, Warriors stay perfect in Sydney - ABC News
item.description:
Sea Eagles repel the Raiders, Warriors stay perfect in Sydney  ABC News

Tom Trbojevic's brilliant night for Manly has ended early and in concern after limping from the field with an ankle injury after guiding the Sea Eagles to a 32-16 victory over winless Canberra. Earlier, the New Zealand Warriors continued their perfect record for 2018, with a comprehensive win over the Sydney Roosters. Trbojevic was at his elusive best at Brookvale Oval, setting up three tries and scoring one in a scintillating first half and adding a fourth assist in the second stanza. However he was injured in a tackle while passing with just eight minutes to play. He walked from the field...

item.title: England survive dramatic Tonga revival to reach Rugby League World Cup final - The Guardian
item.description:
England survive dramatic Tonga revival to reach Rugby League World Cup final  The Guardian

With around 10 minutes left of this quite incredible World Cup semi-final, you knew there was something missing. At that stage England were cruising: 20-0 ahead, defensively impregnable and on their way to the World Cup final at a canter. But this is England’s rugby league side. They do not do things the easy way. In a cacophony of noise in Auckland – which, at first glance, looked and felt every inch like the Tongan capital of Nuku’alofa given the sea of red on show – England had ticked every box required of them in the opening hour. Related: Wayne Bennett: ‘We kept turning up in defence. ...

item.title: Tonga the last obstacle to England’s first World Cup final in 22 years - The Guardian
item.description:
Tonga the last obstacle to England’s first World Cup final in 22 years  The Guardian

James Roby is succinct and to the point when asked for his memories of England’s last World Cup semi-final four years ago: “Heartbreaking.” At 5am UK time on Saturday, Wayne Bennett’s side will aim to reach the final for the first time since 1995 when they face Tonga in Auckland. For anyone connected to English rugby league it will be hard not to think back to 24 November 2013. That day, in the autumnal breeze at Wembley, Shaun Johnson’s try with seconds remaining broke English hearts and ensured New Zealand reached the final. Roby, one of seven survivors from that day who will face the Ton...

item.title: Rugby League World Cup: Fiji edge New Zealand to set up semi-final with Australia - The Independent
item.description:
Rugby League World Cup: Fiji edge New Zealand to set up semi-final with Australia  The Independent

New Zealand are out of the World Cup after Fiji edged a try-less game to book a World Cup semi-final date with Australia. The Kiwis, finalists in the last three tournaments, looked a shadow of their former selves and Fiji took advantage to claim a 4-2 victory in a error-strewn first meeting between the sides. Fiji dominated the first half in Wellington but were too slow and laboured to break the Kiwis down as they failed to add to Apisai Koroisau's penalty. Fiji had the better of the first half (Getty) The Bati could not make the most of Jordan Rapana's sin-binning and only held a slender a...

item.title: Kiwis thump Scotland by huge margin in RLWC clash - ABC News
item.description:
Kiwis thump Scotland by huge margin in RLWC clash  ABC News

Half-back Shaun Johnson has become New Zealand's all-time highest point-scorer after scoring 22 points in the Kiwis' 74-6 obliteration of Scotland in the Rugby League World Cup. Having drawn last year's Four Nations clash with the Bravehearts, David Kidwell's troops hit the ground running in Christchurch and were near-untouchable. They ran in 14 tries to one, with Peta Hiku and Te Maire Martin scoring hat-tricks. Full-back Roger Tuivasa-Sheck nabbed four assists in an utterly destructive attacking display. Even when the match was safely settled, the Kiwis kept their foot on the accelerator ...
